title: Coleen and Wayne Rooney's luxury mansion flooded during Storm Lorenzo
text:
Coleen has had a tough year (Picture: Dave Thompson/ PA Archive)

Coleen and Wayne Rooney’s £20 million mansion has reportedly been flooded because of Storm Lorenzo.

Storm Lorenzo came in with a motive as it flooded the couple’s basement and pushed back the completion date of their Cheshire home.

‘The house is Wayne and Coleen’s dream, so to see it being damaged has been horrible for them,’ a source close to the couple told The Sun.

With the sheer size of the mansion, the costs of fixing the damage will be high.

The source continued: ‘She was called in to find the cellar had been flooded. It was really upsetting.

‘Coleen knows it’s a problem that can be fixed but it’s still been massively stressful.’

She is trying to get the home perfect for Wayne (Picture: BACKGRID)

Coleen had hoped that the property would be renovated before Wayne returned to the UK after finishing his contract with DC United.

The news comes after the mum-of-four had apparently said she is determined to stand by her man rather than divorce her husband and father to their children.

The 33-year-old has been through a lot these last few months no thanks to Wayne being linked to a woman at a hotel, which he strenuously denied was anything inappropriate.

It’s been claimed that Coleen is now facing a barrage of questions from people who want to know what’s going on.

Speaking to heat, an insider close to the couple said: ‘Everyone’s asking Coleen whether her marriage will survive, and she’s said she’s decided to stay with Wayne.

‘She’s thought it through – and she knows people won’t understand.’

The footballer was photographed getting into a hotel lift with a mystery brunette after allegedly going on a ‘seven-hour bender’ while in Canada back in August.

Wayne won’t be returning until January (Picture: Max Mumby/Indigo/Getty Images)

Wayne, 33, was earlier seen dancing with another girl in a club in Vancouver, before heading back to the hotel and getting into the lift together at approximately 5.30 am.

Following the pictures, the footballer tweeted: ‘ Nothing happened between me and any girl on that night in Vancouver. I did not enter the lift alone with the girl pictured in the hotel foyer.

‘The girl pictured in the club was simply one of many who innocently asked for autographs and pictures.’

The source continued: ‘She doesn’t want the uncertainty of a future without Wayne, so staying in the marriage seems like the lesser of two evils.’

Metro.co.uk have contacted reps for comment.
